element.name: Lady with the Lantern by xenotime, jilola, Unknown Cache (3/1)

description.p: This cache will take you on a short walk in Terenure, the land of the yew tree. There are three stages not far from each other and a little bit of math involved. This is our first cache, so your feedback is welcome :-)

element.long-description:
Honora was born far in the South,
in minutes her birthday will be unveiled.
When Irish nation oppressed was so much,
she learnt in France and when she came back
was risking her head to pass knowledge round,
then nursed poor sick people by dreadful nights.
The patron of this cache, whose middle name is Honora, was voted Ireland's greatest woman. She was born in the 18th century in Co. Cork, at the times when teaching Irish Roman Catholics was strictly prohibited. Her family was wealthy enough to send her to France, where she got her education. Soon after coming back to the Emerald Island, she started her school with 30 girls, in a mud cabin of two earthen-floored rooms. After school hours she would visit the poor, the sick and the dying, thus she is often pictured as going about with a lantern in one hand and a stick in the other. Her nick name was Lady with the Lantern.
The coordinates bring you to a wall with a sign in front of a place of knowledge. You will need the Irish text on the sign (26 letters) to find out who is the patron of this place and this cache.
Play hopscotch with the sign, using the numbers below:
6-7-12-18---15-16-*-5-26.
Now, look across the street for an official lamp post with a name on it. Take the first letter from that word to find the missing * letter. Now, have a closer look at the sign on the wall and collect more information:
How many stars are on the logo on the sign? Call it A.
How many Irish words are on the logo on the sign? Call it B.
How many letters are in the 1st Irish word on the sign? Call it C.
How many letters g are in the Irish name on the sign? Call it D.
The coordinates for the second location are N53 18.609 W6 17.301. They should give you a better view behind the wall...
How many crosses can you see on the red brick building? Call it E.
Now, a little bit of maths to find out the final coordinates :-) Calculate the longitude first! 006W 17.E(A/E)(C-1)
Now, some numerology for the latitude: 53N 18.GBD
To get G, you need to divide the decimal part of the longitude by the number of crosses. Call this number F. Now add up the digits of number E and F to get G.
E.g. If your calculated westing was 006W 17.422 and there were 2 crosses, F would be 422/2 = 211 and G would be 2 + 1 + 1 + 2 = 6
The final coordinates will look "nice"...
The final location is in a green residential area where you can spot many birds. Some of the birds nest in the hidden gardens of "the place of knowledge". We have chosen the final cache location to prevent any trouble with officials at the first stage. Hope you will enjoy that short walk!
element.additional-waypoints:
S11N6CG - Stage 1
N 53° 18.606 W 006° 17.262
The plaque
S21N6CG - Stage 2
N 53° 18.609 W 006° 17.301
Count crosses
S31N6CG - Stage 3
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___
the final coordinates
element.encoded-hints: Would any barrier stop this giant?

ul.li:
2010-01-14T20:00:00Z : Found it by Spark_ie
Yippee! [:)] Had the final co-ords worked out a while ago. Didn't find it the first time around, but tonight I had the place to myself.. Well there were people around, but all in home, or in bed !! [:)] Was about to give up again for a second time, but next thing I spotting something, and there it was ! Lovely Jubely! TFTC, Spark_ie

2009-11-15T20:00:00Z : Didn't find it by Spark_ie
Pretty sure I was in the right location, as the hint seemed to sound right... However, I couldn't find the cache. Must check with owner to make sure I have the right co-ords before I'll come back. Thanks, Spark_ie

2009-10-28T19:00:00Z : Owner Maintenance by xenotime
Checked the cache. All in order, dry and well hidden. HINT: the final cache is in the residential area. Spot the wall and then spot the odd thing in the wall... Good luck @

2009-10-11T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by tolmaion
I knew this cache had not been found in ages but as I was passing by anyway, I figured I would give it a try. I found all the items I was supposed to look for at stages 1 and 2 but the final coordinates made no sense. When acquiring the various numbers, I noticed that some of the things I was supposed to count were simply not there - giving me a count of zero and a lot of doubt. I will e-mail the owner and try to find out what is going on. Maybe something has changed in the area and the instructions are no longer correct.

2009-05-24T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by Team ah-aah
My last day in Dublin without a GPS... found location, but no cache, it got dark so had to end hunt :O( TFTH - Katie

wpt.name: GC1N6CG
wpt.desc: Lady with the Lantern by xenotime, jilola, Unknown Cache (3/1)
